oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Chris Gantry - 2018-06-02
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Chris Gantry from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 2, 2018. Includes questions from the audience. Presented in support of the exhibit Outlaws & Armadillos: Country’s Roaring ʼ70s.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chris Gantry;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (02:08) Opening comments by Abi Tapia / (04:24) Introduction by Peter Cooper / (07:38) Opening comments by Chris / (08:32) Performs Outlaw / (12:15) Talks about what Nashville was like when he arrived in 1963 and the inspiration of Vince Matthews and his effect on him and Kris Kristofferson / (13:56) Performs Vince / (18:09) Talks about his first meeting with Kristofferson / (19:21) Performs Here Comes The Captain / (23:01) Talks about working on song writing back in the day and tells story about Gary Puckett and The Union Gap recording one of his songs with Glen Campbell as introduction to the next song / (23:04) Performs Dreams Of The Everyday Housewife / (28:47) Introduces the next song / (29:37) Performs Second Half First / (32:42) Introduces the next song / (33:53) Performs A Box Of Crayons / (40:49) Intros the next song / (42:00) Performs Hey Algernon / (45:51) Talks about his guitar and it's history / (46:45) Intros the next song / (48:02) Performs The Old Songwriter / (51:20) Intros the next song / (51:46) Performs The Ghost Of Music Row / (55:00) Comments by Chris / (55:48) Answers question about what he thinks his biggest accomplishment is / (56:25) Performs Somewhere In Nashville Tonight / (59:22) Final comments / (59:54) Walk-out Music / (01:00:25) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:format: original source recorded as an mp3 file at 44.1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gantry, Chris; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
